arm_group.description: The goal of applying ice and shortwave diathermy to the calf, ankle and sole of the foot was to verify the effect of this resources at the neuromuscular response of the lower limb and postural balance

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study was to evaluate the effect of ice and shortwave diathermy in different
      regions of lower limb neuromuscular response and balance.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analysis of Neuromuscular Responses and the Balance After the Application of Physiotherapy Resources

detailed_description.textblock:
Applying ice and shortwave diathermy was performed separately (on different days) in the
      foot, ankle and calf. To assess the neuromuscular response was evaluated electromyographic
      activity of the rectus femorals, biceps femorals, gastrocnemius and tibialis anterior. To
      assess the effect of applications on balance, through a force platform was evaluated
      oscillation of the center of pressure as well as ground reaction forces.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  woman

          -  healthy

          -  young

          -  sedentary

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  sensory changes

          -  history of fractures in the lower limbs

          -  being in the menstrual period

          -  diabetes Mellitus

          -  Bone, muscle and/or neural diseases

intervention.description: The application of ice has been accomplished by means of a plastic bag containing 1.5 kg of crushed ice. The duration of the application was 30 minutes. The use of shortwave diathermy was performed by means of rectangular electrodes having a duration of 20 minutes.

clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of Neuromuscular Responses and the Balance After the Application of Physiotherapy Resources

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the neuromuscular response, we used the median frequency of the electromyographic variables and root mean square
primary_outcome.measure: Analysis of neuromuscular responses after the application of physiotherapy resources
primary_outcome.time_frame: We evaluated 22 volunteers in a period of one year and 6 months

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate postural balance used the variables: maximum displacement of the center of pressure, speed of displacement of the center of pressure and ground reaction forces as an impulse and braking
primary_outcome.measure: Analysis of body balance after the application of physiotherapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: We evaluated 22 volunteers in a period of one year and 6 months

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the pain during the application of the studied features we use the McGill questionnaire.
secondary_outcome.measure: Pain assessment during application of ice and shortwave diathermy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: We evaluated 22 volunteers in a period of one year and 6 months
